intro: Solanum eshbaughianum, commonly known as the Eshbaugh's nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants such as tomatoes and potatoes. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale purple, and it bears berries that turn from green to yellow as they mature. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and it thrives in cool, high-altitude environments. Due to its limited distribution and unique appearance, it is of interest to botanists and plant collectors.
